com.ibm.ccl.soa.core.saf.handler
Interface IImplementationHandler

All Superinterfaces:
IHandler
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractImplementationHandler
public interface IImplementationHandler
extends IHandler

This interface must be implemented by all Implementation handlers. Most handlers should extend the abstract class AbstractComponentHandler which provides default behavior for a number of methods.

Method Detail

createImplementation

com.ibm.ccl.soa.core.sca.Implementation createImplementation()
                                                             throws SAFException
Creates a implementation of the kind this handler is specialized for.

Returns:
the new implementation object
Throws:
SAFException - when a implementation cannot be created

canCreateImplementationFor

boolean canCreateImplementationFor(java.lang.Object implementationObj)
Queries if a implementation of the kind supported by this handler can be created for the specified implementation object. If this method returns true, the handler's createImplementationFor(Object) method may be called to create a implementation for the object (think it as a bottom-up approach).

This method should be quick to execute, because it may be called to populate a context menu or a user dialog.

Parameters:
implementationObj - an object representing the implementation for a component
Returns:
true if the handler can create an Implementation object from the specified file; false otherwise

createImplementationFor

com.ibm.ccl.soa.core.sca.Implementation createImplementationFor(java.lang.Object implementationObj)
                                                                throws SAFException,
                                                                       java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                                                       InvalidOperationException
Creates a Implementation based on the specified implementation object. Think this as a bottom-up approach.

Parameters:
implementationObj - the object representing the implementation for the component
Returns:
Implementation
Throws:
SAFException - an unexpected exception occurred
InvalidOperationException - a component cannot be created for the given implementation object
java.lang.InterruptedException - the caller did not provide a callback object needed by the handler, or the callback request was canceled or aborted

canGenerateImplementation

boolean canGenerateImplementation()
Queries if implementation files can be generated for Component whose implemenation was created by this handler. A caller can use this method to distinguish fully functional implementation handlers from those that do not provide support for generating implementations for the Implementation they create.

Returns:
true if support is provided for generating implementation files ; false otherwise

generateImplementationFor

org.eclipse.wst.common.frameworks.datamodel.IDataModelOperation generateImplementationFor(com.ibm.ccl.soa.core.sca.Component theComponent,
                                                                                          org.eclipse.core.resources.IContainer container)
                                                                                          throws SAFException,
                                                                                                 java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                                                                                 InvalidOperationException
Creates an implementation file or files for the specified component based on the definition of the component. The handler is expected to update the implementation object in the component to reference the generated file or files, if necessary. The implementation file or files will be regenerated and replaced. User changes made to these files will be not be preserved.

This method should be aware that the implementation files it generates may replace some already being managed in a team environment.

Parameters:
theComponent - the component whose implementation is to be generated
container - the IContainer that holds the module, subsystem, composite, etc. that contains the given component. The handler could use the container's location to generate relative file paths that it stores in the component (to reference the implementation file, for example) or use the location as a place for additional files that need to be generated.
Returns:
an IDataModelOperation instance that, once executed by the caller, creates the new implementation
Throws:
SAFException - an unexpected exception occurred
InvalidOperationException - an implementation cannot be created for the given component kind
java.lang.InterruptedException - the caller did not provide a callback object needed by the handler, or the callback request was canceled or aborted.

getImplementationFilesFor

org.eclipse.core.resources.IFile[] getImplementationFilesFor(com.ibm.ccl.soa.core.sca.Implementation theImplementation)
                                                             throws SAFException
Returns an array of implementation files associated with the given component. The "primary" file should be the first element in the array.

Parameters:
theImplementation - the component whose implementation files are returned
Returns:
an array of the associated implementation files
Throws:
SAFException - An error occurred finding the implementation files.

canAddReference

boolean canAddReference()
Queries if a reference can be added by the client to a component of the supported kind.

Returns:
true if the client is allowed to add a reference object; false otherwise

canAddService

boolean canAddService()
Queries if a service can be added by the client to a component of the supported kind.

Returns:
true if the client is allowed to add a service object; false otherwise

canSetInterface

boolean canSetInterface()
Queries if an interface can be set by the client in an existing service or reference contained by a component of the supported kind.

Returns:
true if the client is allowed to set the interface on a given service or reference object; false otherwise

isInterfaceKindSupported

boolean isInterfaceKindSupported(IInterfaceHandler interfaceHandler,
                                 boolean serviceReferenceFlag)
                                 throws SAFException
Queries if a Implemenation of the kind supported by this handler supports interfaces of the kind specified by the given interface handler in its services or references.

Parameters:
interfaceHandler - the interface handler that will be used to manipulate the interface. The implementation of this method can obtain the interface kind by invoking IHandler.getKind() when performing the evaluation.
serviceReferenceFlag - flag indicating if the query applies to the services of the component or its references. The values AbstractImplementationHandler.SERVICE and AbstractImplementationHandler.REFERENCE can be used for improved code readability.
Returns:
true if the Implemenation supports the specified use of the interface kind; false otherwise
Throws:
SAFException - An unexpected exception occurred in the handler.
